identificationModule.briefTitle: Study of Olomorasib (LY3537982) in Combination With Standard of Care in Participants With Resected or Unresectable KRAS G12C-mutant Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase 3, Multicenter, Double-Blind, Placebo-controlled Study Assessing the Efficacy and Safety of Olomorasib in Combination With Standard of Care Immunotherapy in Participants With Resected or Unresectable KRAS G12C-Mutant, Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer - SUNRAY-02

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The main purpose of this study is to assess if olomorasib in combination with pembrolizumab is more effective than the pembrolizumab and placebo combination in part A in participants with resected KRAS G12C-mutant NSCLC and to assess if olomorasib in combination with durvalumab is more effective than the durvalumab and placebo combination in part B in participants with unresectable KRAS G12C-mutant non-small cell lung cancer. The study may last up to 3 years for each participant.

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: Both Part A and B are randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled.

armGroups.label: Part A: Olomorasib + Pembrolizumab
armGroups.description: Participants will receive olomorasib administered orally in combination with pembrolizumab intravenously (IV) for up to 1 year followed by olomorasib alone for up to 3 years of total treatment.

armGroups.label: Part A: Placebo + Pembrolizumab
armGroups.description: Participants will receive placebo administered orally in combination with pembrolizumab administered IV for up to 1 year followed by placebo alone for up to 3 years of total treatment.

armGroups.label: Part B: Olomorasib + Durvalumab
armGroups.description: Participants will receive olomorasib administered orally in combination with durvalumab administered IV for up to 1 year followed by olomorasib alone for up to 3 years of total treatment.

armGroups.label: Part B: Placebo + Durvalumab
armGroups.description: Participants will receive placebo administered orally in combination with durvalumab administered IV for up to 1 year followed by placebo alone for up to 3 years of total treatment.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Part A: Disease-Free Survival (DFS) by Investigator Assessment
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to disease recurrence or death from any cause (Estimated as approximately 48 months).

primaryOutcomes.description: PFS per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) v1.1 by blinded independent central review (BICR)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to disease progression or death from any cause (Estimated as approximately 3 years).

secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to disease progression or death from any cause (Estimated as approximately 5 years).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Part A & B: Change from baseline in health-related quality of life (HRQoL), measured by European Organization for Research & Treatment of CancerQualityofLifeQuestionnaire-Core 30 (EORTC QLQ-C30)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change from baseline in HRQoL, measured by the EORTC QLQ-C30
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization through end of treatment (Estimated as approximately 3 years).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Part B: Objective Response Rate (ORR) per RECIST 1.1 by BICR
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to disease progression or death from any cause (Estimated as approximately 3 years).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Part B: Duration of Response (DOR) per RECIST 1.1 by BICR
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to disease progression or death from any cause (Estimated as approximately 3 years).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Part B: Disease Control Rate (DCR) per RECIST 1.1 by BICR
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to disease progression or death from any cause (Estimated as approximately 3 years).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Part B: Time to Response (TTR) per RECIST 1.1 by BICR
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization until the date that measurement criteria for CR or PR (whichever is first recorded) are first met (Estimated as approximately 3 years).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Part B: Progression-Free Survival 2 (PFS2) by investigator assessment
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to disease progression on next line of treatment or death from any cause (Estimated as approximately 3 years).]

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Part B: Changes in Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC)-related symptoms, measured by the NSCLC-Symptom Assessment Questionnaire (SAQ)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Changes in NSCLC-related symptoms, measured by the NSCLC-SAQ
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization through end of treatment (Estimated as approximately 3 years).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Part B: Time to worsening of NSCLC-related symptoms, as measured by NSCLC-SAQ
secondaryOutcomes.description: Time to worsening of NSCLC-related symptoms, as measured by NSCLC-SAQ
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization through end of treatment (Estimated as approximately 3 years).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Part B: Changes in patient-reported pulmonary symptoms of cough, chest pain, and dyspnea, measured by NSCLC-SAQ
secondaryOutcomes.description: Changes in patient-reported pulmonary symptoms of cough, chest pain, and dyspnea, measured by NSCLC-SAQ
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization through end of treatment (Estimated as approximately 3 years).

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Histological or cytological confirmation of NSCLC.

  * Part A

    1. Clinical Stage II-IIIB (N2) treated with presurgical chemoimmunotherapy, with residual tumor present at time of surgery. Patients with a pathologic complete response are not eligible.
    2. Pathologic Stage II-IIIB (N2) NSCLC treated with initial upfront resection.
  * Part B - Clinical Stage III, unresectable NSCLC, without progression on concurrent platinum-based chemoradiotherapy.
* Must have disease with evidence of KRAS G12C mutation.
* Must have known programmed death-ligand 1 (PD-L1) expression
* Must have an ECOG performance status of 0 or 1.
* Able to swallow oral medication.
* Must have adequate laboratory parameters.
* Contraceptive use should be consistent with local regulations for those participating in clinical studies.
* Women of childbearing potential must

  * Have a negative pregnancy test.
  * Not be breastfeeding during treatment

Exclusion Criteria:

* Have known changes in the EGFR or ALK genes.
* Have another type of cancer that is progressing or required active treatment within the past 3 years before screening.
* Have an active autoimmune disease that required systemic treatment in the past 2 years. Endocrine replacement therapy is allowed.
* Had any immune-related side effect or allergic reaction (Grade 3 or higher) from a previous immunotherapy medicine, or any immune-related side effect greater than Grade 1 that has not resolved. This does not apply for people with hormone-related diseases who are now on stable hormone replacement therapy.

seeAlsoLinks.label: Study of Olomorasib (LY3537982) in Combination With Standard of Care in Participants With Resected or Unresectable KRAS G12C-mutant Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (SUNRAY-02)

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: Anonymized individual patient level data will be provided in a secure access environment upon approval of a research proposal and a signed data sharing agreement.
ipdSharingStatementModule.timeFrame: Data are available 6 months after the primary publication and approval of the indication studied in the US and EU, whichever is later. Data will be indefinitely available for requesting.
ipdSharingStatementModule.accessCriteria: A research proposal must be approved by an independent review panel and researchers must sign a data sharing agreement.
